Typealiases.html#/s:12SwiftletData8ADRec.name: ADRecord

Typealiases.html#/s:12SwiftletData11ADRe.name: ADRecordSet
Typealiases.html#/s:12SwiftletData11ADRe.abstract: Defines an array of ADRecord instances that can be sent to or returned from a ADDataProvider or any of the Action Codable controls.

Structs/ADSQLTableConstraint/TableConstr.name: foreignKey

Structs/ADSQLResultColumn.html#/s:12Swif.name: columnAlias

Structs/ADSQLOrderByClause.html#/s:12Swi.name: columnName
Structs/ADSQLOrderByClause.html#/s:12Swi.abstract: The name of the column used to order the results.

Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.name: type

Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.name: constraints
Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.abstract: A list of optional constraints for the column.

Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.name: init()
Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.abstract: Creates a new instance of the column definition.

Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.name: init(columnName:)
Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html#/s:12.abstract: Creates a new instance of the column definition.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: primaryKeyAsc
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: The column is the primary key for the table in an ascending order.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: primaryKeyDesc
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: The column is the primary key for the table in a descending order.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: unique
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: The column’s value must be unique inside the table.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: check
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: A custom constraint is being applied to the columns value.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: defaultValue
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: If this column is NULL, it will be replaced with this default value.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.name: foreignKey
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint/ColumnCons.abstract: The column value is a foreign key to another table’s row.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.name: autoIncrement
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.abstract: If the column is a PRIMARY KEY of the INTEGER type, is it automatically incremented when a new row is created in the table.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.name: conflictHandling
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.abstract: Defines how conflicts should be handled for this column.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.name: expression
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.abstract: Holds the expression for a Check or Default Value constraint.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.name: init()
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.abstract: Initializes a new instance of the Column Constraint.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.name: init(ofType:withExpression:)
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html#/s:12.abstract: Initializes a new instance of the Column Constraint.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: update
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: updateOrRollback
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table and rollback if unable to update.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: updateOrAbort
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table and abort if unable to update.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: updateOrReplace
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update or replace a row in the table.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: updateOrFail
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table and fail if unable to update.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.name: updateOrIgnore
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to update a row in the table and ignore the issue if unable to update.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.name: tableName
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the table being updated.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.name: setClauses
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: A list of columns and values being written to the row.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.name: whereExpression
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional expression controlling the rows to update.

Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction/Acti.name: Action
Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction/Acti.abstract: Defines the type of transaction being performed.

Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.name: savepointName
Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.abstract: For ROLLBACK, SAVEPOINT and RELEASE transactions, defines the name of the save point.

Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.name: init()
Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.abstract: Creates a new instance of the transaction.

Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.name: init(forAction:)
Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.abstract: Creates a new instance of the transaction.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: distinct
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, a distince set of values will be returned, else false.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: columns
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The list of columns returned by this select statement.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: fromSouce
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The source table (or tables) that the columns are read from.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: whereExpression
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The WHERE clause defining which table rows should be returned. If this expression if nil, all rows will be returned.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: groupByColumns
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional GROUP BY clause used to group the results of the SELECT statement.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: havingExpression
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional HAVING clause to control when specific columns should be grouped.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: orderBy
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional group of columns used to sort the resulting table rows.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: limit
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: Defines the maximum number of rows returned. If -1, all rows will be returned.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.name: offset
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: Defines an offest from the first row to start returning rows for. If -1, the results start with the first row.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrReplace
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Either insert a new or replace an existing row.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrRollback
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and rollback if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrAbort
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and abort if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrFail
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and fail if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.name: insertOrIgnore
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction/Action.ht.abstract: Attempt to insert a new row and ignore the issue if the row cannot be created.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: tableName
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the table that a row is being inserted into.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: columnNames
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the columns being inserted into the table row.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: values
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The values to insert into the table row.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: selectStatement
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional SELECT statement used to populate the new table row(s).

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.name: defaultValues
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: If true, the new row should be created with the default value of the table.

Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction/Action.html.name: Action
Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction/Action.html.abstract: Defines the type of object being removed from the data source.

Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.name: action
Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.abstract: Defines what is being removed from the data source.

Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.name: ifExists
Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.abstract: If true, the item will only be dropped if it exists in the data source.

Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.name: itemName
Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html#/s:12S.abstract: The name of the item being removed from the data source.

Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html#/s:1.name: tableName
Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the table that rows will be deleted from.

Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html#/s:1.name: whereExpression
Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html#/s:1.abstract: An optional WHERE clause used to determine the rows of the table to delete. If nil all rows in the table will be deleted.

Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.name: viewName
Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.abstract: The name of the view being created.

Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.name: columnList
Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.abstract: The list of columns in the view.

Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.name: selectStatement
Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html#.abstract: The SQL SELECT statement used to populate the view.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.name: delete
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.abstract: The triger will fire on delete statements.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.name: insert
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.abstract: The trigger will fire on insert statements.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.name: updateOf
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Tr.abstract: The trigger will fire on update statements.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.name: before
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.abstract: The trigger will execute before the SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.name: after
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.abstract: The trigger will execute after the SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.name: insteadOf
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.abstract: The trigger will execute instead of the SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.name: WhenToTrigger
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction/Wh.abstract: Defines when a triger should be fired.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: triggerName
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: The name of the trigger being created.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: triggerType
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: Defines the type of trigger being created.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: columnList
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: Defines the list of columns that form the trigger.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: tableName
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: Defines the table that the trigger is being created against.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: forEachRow
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: If true, the trigger will execute after each table row being modified by a SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: whenExpression
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: The expression defining when the trigger will fire.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: instructions
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: A list of instruction to run when the trigger fires.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: name
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: The name of the table being created.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: isTemporary
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: If true this is a temporary table, else false.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: ifNotExists
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: If true the table should only be created if it doesn’t already exist, else false.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: columns
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: A list of columns being created in the table.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: constraints
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: An optional list of constraints being applied to the table.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: withoutRowID
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: If true the table does not have an internal row id, else false.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: selectStatement
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: If this is a CREATE TABLE name AS SELECT… statement, this property holds the SELECT statement.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: init()
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: Initializes a new instance of the Create Table Instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: init(tableName:_:_:)
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: Initializes a new instance of the Create Table Instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.name: indexName
Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.abstract: The name of the index being created.

Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.name: tableName
Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.abstract: The name of the table that the index is being created on.

Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.name: columnList
Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.abstract: The list of columns in the index.

Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.name: whereExpression
Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.abstract: The optional WHERE clause that controls which table rows are included in the Index.

Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.name: name
Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.abstract: The name of the table being modified.

Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.name: renameTo
Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.abstract: If renaming the table, this will be the table’s new name.

Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.name: column
Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html#.abstract: The definition of a columns being added.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: crossReferenceName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: The name of the cross reference table.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: leftKeyName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: The name of the left-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the left side of the relationship.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: rightKeyName
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: The name of the right-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the right side of the relationship.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: storage
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Stores all child ADDataTable instances that are a part of the cross reference relationship to the left-side primary key value.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: subscript(_:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Provides quick access to the items in the storage property.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: count
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns the number of ADDataTable instances in the cross reference.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: init(name:leftKeyName:rightKeyName:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Creates a new instance of the ADCrossReference with the given table name and key names.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: next()
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns the next item in a sequence.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: append(_:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Adds the given ADDataTable instance to the cross reference’s storage.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: remove(at:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Removes the given ADDataTable instance from the reference’s storage.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: ensureCrossReferenceExists(in:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Ensures the given cross reference table exists in the given data provider and left-side key value and creates it if required.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: delete(from:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Removes all cross references for the given key value from the given data provider.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: save(to:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Saves the given cross references to the data provider for the give key value. The cross reference table will automatically be created if it doesn’t already exist.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.name: load(from:forKeyValue:)
Structs/ADCrossReference.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Loads all cross referenced ADDataTable instances for the given cross reference based on the given key value.

Structs/ADCrossReference.html.name: ADCrossReference
Structs/ADCrossReference.html.abstract: Creates and maintains a one-to-many or many-to-many cross reference relationship between two ADDataTable instances that can be stored in or read from a ADDataProvider.

Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html.name: ADSQLAlterTableInstruction
Structs/ADSQLAlterTableInstruction.html.abstract: Holds the information for a SQL ALTER TABLE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.name: ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction
Structs/ADSQLCreateIndexInstruction.html.abstract: Holds the information for a SQL CREATE INDEX instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.name: ADSQLCreateTableInstruction
Structs/ADSQLCreateTableInstruction.html.abstract: Holds information about a SQL CREATE TABLE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.name: ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction
Structs/ADSQLCreateTriggerInstruction.ht.abstract: Holds information about a SQL CREATE TRIGGER instruction.

Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html.name: ADSQLCreateViewInstruction
Structs/ADSQLCreateViewInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all the information for a SQL CREATE VIEW instruction.

Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html.name: ADSQLDeleteInstruction
Structs/ADSQLDeleteInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all information about a SQL DELETE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html.name: ADSQLDropInstruction
Structs/ADSQLDropInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all information about a SQL DROP instruction.

Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html.name: ADSQLInsertInstruction
Structs/ADSQLInsertInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all information about a SQL INSERT instruction.

Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html.name: ADSQLSelectInstruction
Structs/ADSQLSelectInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all information about a SQL SELECT instruction.

Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.name: ADSQLTransactionInstruction
Structs/ADSQLTransactionInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all information about a SQL BEGIN, COMMIT, END, ROLLBACK, SAVEPOINT or RELEASE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html.name: ADSQLUpdateInstruction
Structs/ADSQLUpdateInstruction.html.abstract: Holds all of the information for a SQL UPDATE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html.name: ADSQLColumnConstraint
Structs/ADSQLColumnConstraint.html.abstract: Holds information about a constraint applied to a Column Definition that has been parsed from a SQL CREATE TABLE instruction.

Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html.name: ADSQLColumnDefinition
Structs/ADSQLColumnDefinition.html.abstract: Holds information about a column definition read from a CREATE TABLE instruction when parsing a SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLOrderByClause.html.name: ADSQLOrderByClause
Structs/ADSQLOrderByClause.html.abstract: Holds information about a result ordering statement from a SQL SELECT statement.

Structs/ADSQLResultColumn.html.name: ADSQLResultColumn
Structs/ADSQLResultColumn.html.abstract: Holds a result column definition for a SELECT SQL statement.

Structs/ADSQLSetClause.html.name: ADSQLSetClause
Structs/ADSQLSetClause.html.abstract: Holds information about a value that is being written into a table’s column from a SQL UPDATE statement.

Structs/ADSQLTableConstraint.html.name: ADSQLTableConstraint
Structs/ADSQLTableConstraint.html.abstract: Holds information about a constraint being applied to table from a CREATE TABLE SQL instruction.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.name: init(fromInstance:)
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Decodes the expression from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.name: evaluate(forRecord:)
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Evaluates the given expression and returns a result based on the data in the record passed in.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.name: encode()
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Encodes the expression into an Instance Dictionary for storage in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) format.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.name: decode(fromInstance:)
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Decodes the expression from an Instance Dictionary that has been read from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) stream.

Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: tableName
Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Gets the name of the table that the data is stored in.

Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: primaryKey
Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Returns the key for the table property that acts as the record’s primary key. Typically this defaults to a field called id.

Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: primaryKeyType
Protocols/ADDataTable.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Returns the type of primary key. Typically, the default type is uniqueValue.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: isOpen
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Is there currently a data source open for the provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: isReadOnly
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Can the data provider write to the given data source.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: knownTables
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: An array of all tables that have been read from or written to the given data source.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: openSource(_:fromBundle:readOnly:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Opens the given source file for the data provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: createSource(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Creates the given source file for the data provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: saveSource(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Saves an in-memory database to the given filename or copies a disk-based database (such as SQLite) to the new filename.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: persist()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: For in-memory data sources, writes the contents of the in-memory source to persistant storage.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: closeSource()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Closes any open data source attached to the data provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: deleteSource(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: For writable data sources, delete the data source with the specified file name.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: execute(_:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Execute SQL (non-query) command with (optional) parameters and return result code.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: query(_:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Run an SQL query with (parameters) parameters and returns an array of dictionaries where the keys are the column names.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: tableExists(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Checks to see if the given table exists in the SQLite database.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: countRows(inTable:filteredBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Counts the number of records in a given table, optionally filtered by a given set of contraints where a “table” represents the base unit of data (for example a SQLite table or JSON node) for the source of the data provider.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: lastIntID(forTable:withKey:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Gets the largest used number for the given integer primary key of the given table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: lastAutoID(forTable:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Gets the last auto generated integer ID for the given table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: registerTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Registers the given ADDataTable class schema with the data provider and creates a table for the class if it doesn’t already exist.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: updateTableSchema(_:withDefaultValues:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Attempts to modify the data source table schema to match the schema of the given ADDataTable class if the schema has changed. If the table does not exist, it will attempt to be registered with the data source. If any new columns have been added, the default values will be set from the given defaults.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: hasRow(forType:matchingPrimaryKey:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Checks to see if a row matching the given primary key exists in the underlying SQLite table.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: rowCount(forType:filterBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Return the count of rows in the table, or the count of rows matching a specific filter criteria, if one was provided.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: make(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Creates an instance of the given ADDataTable class automatically setting the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: makeID(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns a value for the primaryKey field based on the value of the primaryKeyType for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: getTableSchema(forTableName:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns all information about a given table in the data source including all of the columns and their types.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: save(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Saves the given class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the data source. If the data source does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: save(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Saves the given array of class instances conforming to the ADDataTable protocol to the data source. If the data source does not contain a table named in the tableName property, one will be created first. If a record is not on file matching the primaryKey value, a new record will be created, else the existing record will be updated.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: getRows(ofType:fliteredBy:orderedBy:startingAt:limitedTo:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns rows from the data source of the given class type optionally filtered, sorted and limited to a specific range of results.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: getRows(ofType:matchingSQL:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns rows from the data source of the given class type matching the given SQL statement.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: getRow(ofType:forPrimaryKeyValue:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns a row from the SQLite database of the given class type matching the given primary key value.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: getRow(ofType:atIndex:fliteredBy:orderedBy:withParameters:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Returns a row from the data source of the given class type optionally filtered and limited to a specific range of results.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: delete(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Deletes the row matching the given record from the SQLite database.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: delete(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Deletes the given set of records from the data source.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: dropTable(_:)
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Drops the underlying table from the data source, completely removing all stored data in the table as well as the table itself.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: beginTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Starts an explicit transaction to process a batch of data source changes. Once started, the transaction will remain open until it is either committed (via endTransaction) or rolled-back (via `rollbackTransaction).

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: endTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Attempts to commit any chages to the data source and close the current transaction that was opened using beginTransaction.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.name: rollbackTransaction()
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Ends the current transaction (opened using beginTransaction) and undoes any changes made to the data source since the transaction was opened.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: crossReferenceName
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the cross reference table.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: leftKeyName
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the left-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the left side of the relationship.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: rightKeyName
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: The name of the right-side key used to store the primary key of the ADDataTable on the right side of the relationship.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: delete(from:forKeyValue:)
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: Removes all cross references for the given key value from the given data provider.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: save(to:forKeyValue:)
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: Saves the given cross references to the data provider for the give key value. The cross reference table will automatically be created if it doesn’t already exist.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.name: load(from:forKeyValue:)
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html#/s:1.abstract: Loads all cross referenced ADDataTable instances for the given cross reference based on the given key value.

Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html.name: ADDataCrossReference
Protocols/ADDataCrossReference.html.abstract: A class or struct conforming to this protocol can be used to store a one-to-many or many-to-many relationship between ADDataTable records stored in or read from a ADDataProvider instance.

Protocols/ADDataProvider.html.name: ADDataProvider
Protocols/ADDataProvider.html.abstract: Defines an Action Data Provider that can be used to read and write data from a given data source.

Protocols/ADDataTable.html.name: ADDataTable
Protocols/ADDataTable.html.abstract: A class conforming to this protocol defines a unique container that holds the data that can be read from or written to a ADDataProvider source. For example, a ADDataTable can be used represent a SQLite database table, a JSON node or a XML node.

Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html.name: ADSQLExpression
Protocols/ADSQLExpression.html.abstract: Holds information about a expression parsed from a SQL instruction.

Protocols.html#/s:12SwiftletData16ADSQLI.name: ADSQLInstruction
Protocols.html#/s:12SwiftletData16ADSQLI.abstract: Holds information about an instruction parsed from a SQL statement.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: unknownKeyword(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered an unknown keyword in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: unknownFunctionName(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered an unknown function name in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: invalidKeyword(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered an invalid keyword in the SQL Command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: mismatchedSingleQuotes(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered a value in single quotes that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: mismatchedDoubleQuotes(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered a value in double quotes that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: mismatchedParenthesis(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered a value in parenthesis that is not properly terminated. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: malformedSQLCommand(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser encountered a value that it was not expecting. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: expectedIntValue(message:)
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The parser expected an integer as the next value. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: ltrim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Trims any white spaces off of the left side of a string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: trim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Trims any white spaces off both sides of a string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: instr
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Tests to see if one string contains another.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: replace
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Replaces all instances of one string inside another.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: upper
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Converts the string to upper case.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: length
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the length of the string in characters.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: rtrim
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Trims any white spaces off of the right side of the string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: lower
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Converts the string to lower case.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: substr
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the requested portion of the string.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: abs
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the absolute value of a number.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: max
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the maximum value of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: round
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Rounds the given number.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: avg
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the average of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: min
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the minimum value of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: sum
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the sum of a group of numbers.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: count
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the number of records in a group.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: random
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns a random number

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: date
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the date in this format: YYYY-MM-DD.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: julianday
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the current date in Julian notation.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: strftime
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Formats the date as a string based on a set of formatting instructions.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: datetime
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the current date and time in the YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS format.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: now
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the current date and time.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: time
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the time as HH:MM:SS

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: coalesce
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Accepts two or more arguments and returns the first non-null argument

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: lastInsertedRowID
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns the ID of the last row inserted into any table.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: ifNull
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Accepts two or more arguments and returns the first non-null argument.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: nullIf
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Returns NULL if any of the passed values are null.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: check
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Handles an internal check operation.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: compare
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Performs a comparison and returns one value if the comparison is true and another if it is false.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.name: get(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html#/s:12SwiftletDa.abstract: Attempts to return a function type for the given string value.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: nullType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Database NULL is the same as a Swift nil.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: integerType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Holds any type of Swift integer data types (Int, UInt, Int32, etc.)

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: colorType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Holds a color definition as a text string in the form #RRGGBBAA.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: blobType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Holds any Swift Data value. To store images, use the Action Utilities toData() method.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: noneType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: The database has an undefined type and can hold any type of Swift data.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: get(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Attempts to get the type from a string.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.name: set(fromString:)
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html#/s:12Swiftlet.abstract: Sets the column type from a string value.

Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html#/s:12Swi.name: privateDatabase
Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html#/s:12Swi.abstract: The database containing the users private data.

Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html#/s:12Swi.name: publicDatabase
Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html#/s:12Swi.abstract: The database containing the data shared by all users.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: duplicateTable(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The table already exists inside of the data store. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unsupportedCommand(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The requested SQL command isn’t supported by Action Data or then current Data Provider. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: invalidCommand(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The requested SQL command isn’t valid in the given context. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unknownTable(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data store doesn’t contain the given table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unknownColumn(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data store doesn’t contain the given column in the given table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: syntaxError(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data store could not execute the SQL command because it contained a syntax error. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: invalidRecord(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The ADRecord is not valid for the given data table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: duplicateRecord(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: A record with the same primary key already exists in the table. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedCheckConstraint(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: An attempt to insert or update a record failed due to a CHECK constraint. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: noRowsReturned(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The SELECT clause in a CREATE statement returned no rows. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unevenNumberOfParameters(message:)
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The number of parameters (specified by a ? in the SQL statement) did not match the number of parameters provided. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.name: uniqueValue
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: Specifies that the given primary key must be unique and not already exist for any other key in the data provider’s data source.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.name: autoIncrementingInt
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: For an Int type of primary key, automatically assign a key value when a new row is added to the data provider’s data source.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.name: computedInt
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: For an Int type of primary key, automatically assign a key value when a new row is added to the data provider’s data source by finding the largest used ID number and adding one to it.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.name: autoUUIDString
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html#/s:12Swift.abstract: For a String type of primary key, automatically assign a UUID as the key value when a new class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol is created.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: dataSourceNotOpen
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider is attempting to work with a datasource before it has been opened.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: dataSourceCopyFailed(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Failed to copy a writable version of the database source from the app’s bundle to the documents directory. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: dataSourceNotFound
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: Unable to open the data source from the given location or with the given name.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unableToOpenDataSource
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to open the given data source.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedToDeleteSource
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider failed to delete the data source.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: tableNotFound(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider does not have the requested table name on file. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedToPrepareSQL(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to prepare the SQL statement for execution while binding the passed set of parameters. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: parameterCountMismatch
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The number of parameters specified in the SQL statement did not match the number of parameters passed to the data provider.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unableToBindParameter(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to bind a given parameter to the SQL statement. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedToCreateTable(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to create the requested table in the data source. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedToExecuteSQL(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to execute the given SQL statement. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: failedToUpdateTableSchema(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to update the given table schema to the new version. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unableToGetRows(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to fetch the requested row(s) from the data source. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: batchUpdateFailed(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: The data provider was unable to complete the given batch update command. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: missingRequiredValue(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: While attempting to create or update a table schema, the data provider encountered a nil value. Use either the register or update functions with a fully populated default value class instance (with all values set to a default, non-nil value) to create or update the table schema. message contains the details of the given failure.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: unableToConvertValue(message:)
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: While reading a value from a CloudKit record, the data provider was unable to move that value forward.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.name: noRowsRemaining
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html#/s:12Swif.abstract: No further rows are remaining from a call to getRows.

Enums/ADDataProviderError.html.name: ADDataProviderError
Enums/ADDataProviderError.html.abstract: Defines the type of errors that can arise when working with a data provider that conforms to the ADDataProvider protocol.

Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html.name: ADDataTableKeyType
Enums/ADDataTableKeyType.html.abstract: Defines the type of primary key that has been specified for a class conforming to the ADDataTable protocol.

Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html.name: ADSQLExecutionError
Enums/ADSQLExecutionError.html.abstract: Defines the errors that can be thrown when executing SQL statements.

Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html.name: ADiCloudDatabaseType
Enums/ADiCloudDatabaseType.html.abstract: Holds the type of database that an instance of the ADiCloudProvider will access.

Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html.name: ADSQLColumnType
Enums/ADSQLColumnType.html.abstract: Defines the type of a column stored in a SQL data source. Currently, these support the same data types as SQLite: NULL, INTEGER, FLOAT, TEXT, BLOB, NONE, DATE and BOOLEAN.

Enums/ADSQLConflictHandling.html.name: ADSQLConflictHandling
Enums/ADSQLConflictHandling.html.abstract: Defines the type of conflict handling that can be applied to a column or table constraint.

Enums/ADSQLFunction.html.name: ADSQLFunction
Enums/ADSQLFunction.html.abstract: Defines the type of functions that can be called in a SQL expression.

Enums/ADSQLKeyword.html.name: ADSQLKeyword
Enums/ADSQLKeyword.html.abstract: Contains a list of all valid SQL keywords that the ADSQLParser can understand.

Enums/ADSQLParseError.html.name: ADSQLParseError
Enums/ADSQLParseError.html.abstract: Defines the type of errors that can arise when parsing a SQL command string.

Global%20Variables.html#/s:12SwiftletDat.name: SQLITE_DATE
Global%20Variables.html#/s:12SwiftletDat.abstract: Defines the type for a SQLite Date value.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.name: none
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.abstract: This join represents an individual table name.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.name: natural
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.abstract: The table is joined to another table where on any fields that have the same name and value.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.name: leftOuter
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.abstract: This table is Left Outer Joined to another table.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.name: inner
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.abstract: This table is Inner Joined to another table.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.name: cross
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause/JoinType.html#/s.abstract: This table is Cross Joined to another table.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html#/s:12Swiftl.name: parentTable
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html#/s:12Swiftl.abstract: The name of the parent table in a join operation or a literal table name is no join is being performed and the type property’s value is none.

Classes/ADSQLEncoder.html.name: ADSQLEncoder

The result is a dictionary of key/value pairs representing the data currently stored in the class. This encoder will automatically handle URLs and Enums (if the Enum is value based and also marked Codable or Encodable).

Classes/ADInstanceArray.html.name: ADInstanceArray
Classes/ADInstanceArray.html.abstract: Defines a passable array of values used as temporary storage when encoding or decoding an Action Data class. ADInstanceArray also introduces support for the new Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data format that allows complex data models to be encoded in a portable text string that encodes not only property keys and data, but also includes type information about the encoded data. For example:

Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html.name: ADInstanceDictionary
Classes/ADInstanceDictionary.html.abstract: Defines a passable dictionary of ADRecord values when encoding or decoding an Action Data class instance. ADInstanceDictionary also introduces support for the new Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data format that allows complex data models to be encoded in a portable text string that encodes not only property keys and data, but also includes type information about the encoded data. For example:

Classes/ADSPONProvider.html.name: ADSPONProvider
Classes/ADSPONProvider.html.abstract: The ADSPONProvider provides both light-weight, low-level access to data stored in a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) database and high-level access via a Object Relationship Management (ORM) model. Use provided functions to read and write data stored in a ADRecord format from and to the database using SQL statements directly.

Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html.name: ADSQLiteProvider
Classes/ADSQLiteProvider.html.abstract: The ADSQLiteProvider provides both light-weight, low-level access to data stored in a SQLite database and high-level access via a Object Relationship Management (ORM) model. Use provided functions to read and write data stored in a ADRecord format from and to the database using SQL statements directly.

Classes/ADiCloudProvider.html.name: ADiCloudProvider
Classes/ADiCloudProvider.html.abstract: The ADiCloudProvider provides both light-weight, low-level access to data stored in a iCloud Database Container (public or private) and high-level access via a Object Relationship Management (ORM) model. Use provided functions to read and write data stored in a ADRecord format from and to the database using SQL like statements directly.

Classes/ADColumnSchema.html.name: ADColumnSchema
Classes/ADColumnSchema.html.abstract: Holds all of the schema information about a table schema’s columns as read from a backing data store.

Classes/ADDataStore.html.name: ADDataStore
Classes/ADDataStore.html.abstract: Represents an in-memory Data Store used to provide SQL ability to data sources that typically do not support SQL (such as JSON or XML). ADDataStore works with ADTableStore to define both the structure of the tables and to contain the rows of data stored in each table. ADDataStore understands a subset of the full SQL instruction set (as known by SQLite).

Classes/ADTableSchema.html.name: ADTableSchema
Classes/ADTableSchema.html.abstract: Holds all the information about a table’s schema as read from a backing data store.

Classes/ADTableStore.html.name: ADTableStore
Classes/ADTableStore.html.abstract: Represents an in-memory SQL Data Store table used to hold both the table’s schema and the data it represents.

Classes/ADUtilities.html.name: ADUtilities
Classes/ADUtilities.html.abstract: Defines a set of utilities to handle data related issues such as comparing two values of type Any.

Classes/ADSQLParser.html.name: ADSQLParser
Classes/ADSQLParser.html.abstract: Parses a SQL statement into an Action Data SQL Document Object Model (DOM). This parser currently supports a subset of SQL commands as defined by SQLite. for example:

Classes/ADSQLBetweenExpression.html.name: ADSQLBetweenExpression
Classes/ADSQLBetweenExpression.html.abstract: Defines a between expression used in a SQL instruction to test if a value is between two other values.

Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html.name: ADSQLBinaryExpression
Classes/ADSQLBinaryExpression.html.abstract: Defines a binary operation being performed on two expressions in a SQL instruction such as adding two values or comparing two values to see if they are equal.

Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html.name: ADSQLCaseExpression
Classes/ADSQLCaseExpression.html.abstract: Defines a case clause used in a SQL instruction.

Classes/ADSQLExpressionBuilder.html.name: ADSQLExpressionBuilder
Classes/ADSQLExpressionBuilder.html.abstract: Helper class to create a ADSQLExpression from a ADInstanceDictionary assembled from a Swift Portable Object Notation (SPON) data stream.

Classes/ADSQLForeignKeyExpression.html.name: ADSQLForeignKeyExpression
Classes/ADSQLForeignKeyExpression.html.abstract: Defines a foreign key expression used in a SQL statement.

Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html.name: ADSQLFunctionExpression
Classes/ADSQLFunctionExpression.html.abstract: Defines a function being called in a SQL instruction such as count or sum.

Classes/ADSQLInExpression.html.name: ADSQLInExpression
Classes/ADSQLInExpression.html.abstract: Defines a in expression used in a SQL instruction to see if a value is in the list of give values.

Classes/ADSQLLiteralExpression.html.name: ADSQLLiteralExpression
Classes/ADSQLLiteralExpression.html.abstract: Defines a literal expression used in a SQL instruction such as a column name, integer value or string constant value.

Classes/ADSQLUnaryExpression.html.name: ADSQLUnaryExpression
Classes/ADSQLUnaryExpression.html.abstract: Defines a unary expression used in a SQL instruction such as forcing a value to be positive or negative.

Classes/ADSQLWhenExpression.html.name: ADSQLWhenExpression
Classes/ADSQLWhenExpression.html.abstract: Defines a when clause using in a CASE clause in a SQL instruction.

Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html.name: ADSQLJoinClause
Classes/ADSQLJoinClause.html.abstract: Holds the source table or table group for a SQL SELECT statement. If the type is none this is a single table name and not a join between two (or more) tables.
